docs.lead_paragraph: COLUMBIA, S. C., July 6 -- South Carolina, which ranks at the bottom of Deep South states in per capita expenditures for public welfare, this week expanded two programs that are expected to mean better health for thousands of its poorest citizens.

headline.main: SOUTH CAROLINA WIDENS WELFARE; Food Stamp Plan Expanded -- Medicaid Put in Effect

docs.abstract: 3% sales tax, which includes food purchases, is expected to pay $550,000 adm cost to state of Fed food stamp program
docs.snippet: COLUMBIA, S. C., July 6 -- South Carolina, which ranks at the bottom of Deep South states in per capita expenditures for public welfare, this week expanded two programs that are expected to mean better health for thousands of its poorest citizens.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: HEALTH AND HOSPITAL INSURANCE AND RELATED GOVERNMENT AID

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO. IN the long parade of fish and flatworms, rats, cats and mice that have given their all for science, it is just possible that Rat No. 895 -- with the help of a bearded psychologist named David Krech -- will hold a special significance for the education of our children's children.

headline.main: The Search For the Memory Molecule; Search for the memory molecule

docs.abstract: D Perlman article on research in interanimal memory transfer; revs past and current research, especially that of Prof D Krech; illus
